Running kmttg using Windows Task Scheduler

You can setup kmttg to run in the background on a schedule of your choosing using Windows Task Scheduler. In Task Scheduler Actions tab you should set the run up as follows:

Program/script = full path to javaw.exe
Arguments = -jar "full path to kmttg.jar" -b
Start in = full path to folder containing kmttg.jar

Example:
Program = "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe"
Arguments = -jar "C:\kmttg\kmttg.jar" -b
Start in = "C:\kmttg"
